questiontext.text: Otto runs 10 miles at 1 p.m. every day. On average, he finishes at 3:50 p.m. with a standard deviation of 10 minutes. His girlfriend Sien starts 30 minutes later and she runs the 10 miles every day exactly twice twice as fast as Otto. What is the average time that Sien finishes, and what is the standard deviation in minutes when she crosses the finish line?

answer.text: Average at 2:25 p.m., standard deviation 5 minutes

feedback.text: Average at 2:25 p.m., standard deviation 5 minutes: Incorrect

answer.text: Average at 2:25 p.m., standard deviation 20 minutes

feedback.text: Average at 2:25 p.m., standard deviation 20 minutes: Incorrect

answer.text: Average at 2:25 p.m., standard deviation 35 minutes

feedback.text: Average at 2:25 p.m., standard deviation 35 minutes: Incorrect

answer.text: Average at 2:55 p.m., standard deviation 5 minutes

feedback.text: Average at 2:55 p.m., standard deviation 5 minutes: Correct

answer.text: Average at 2:55 p.m., standard deviation 35 minutes

feedback.text: Average at 2:55 p.m., standard deviation 35 minutes: Incorrect
